parameters.name: where
parameters.description: The CEQL search expression, or the where clause, without the WHERE keyword, in a typical SQL query. Allowed searches are me (boolean, if 'true' returns only timelogs from current user), plainText (boolean),  subTasks (boolean), descendants (boolean), trackedDate (start and end), and createdDate (start and end). For example, to search for comments posted between a date range (max range of seven days), the search expression will be where=createdDate='{"start": "2016-05-10T15:27:37Z","end": "2016-05-17T15:27:37Z"}'.

summary.x-samplevalue: Create a new contact in the CRM service. Contact creation will flow through Cloud Elements to your CRM service. With the exception of the 'id' field, the required fields indicated in the 'Contact' model are those required to create a new contact.
